Class GProduct

java.lang.Object
org.interworldtransport.cladosG.GProduct
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable<GProduct>, CliffordProduct
public class GProduct extends Object implements CliffordProduct, Comparable<GProduct>
This class defines a geometric product on an associated basis within a Clifford Algebra. The flat space on which multiplication is defined is assumed to be locally tangent to a manifold, but the difference in product results form one tangent space to another are NOT tracked here. Only the structure of the geometric product on a canonical basis is. Other distinctions are kept in the algebra objects that reference a GProduct.

A GProduct object actually assumes it is OK to perform a requested operation and will throw an exception if it discovers later that it isn't. This is true most everywhere except in the constructor where input is examined first.

Most errors can be avoided by using GBuilder to construct this object. However, it shouldn't be necessary to construct a GProduct directly. Best practice is to create an algebra and let it construct its product.

The implemented interface is currently all the methods available in this class. That will change in the future as helper methods are built here that need not be exposed elsewhere.

Version:
2.0
Author:
Dr Alfred W Differ

  • Constructor Details

    • GProduct

      public GProduct(String pSig) throws BadSignatureException
      Main constructor of GProduct with signature information passed in. It figures out the rest of what it needs.

      Parameters:
      pSig - String form of the signature. Looks like "-+++0".
      Throws:
      BadSignatureException - Thrown when an invalid signature is found

    • GProduct

      public GProduct(Optional<Basis> pB, String pSig) throws BadSignatureException
      A re-use constructor of GProduct with signature and Basis passed in. It figures out the rest of what it needs.
      The size of the signature string used to be checked using a static method on Basis, but that was duplicating the effort performed by CliffordProduct when it checks the validity of the string. Size and characters ARE checked.
      Parameters:
      pB - Optional Basis to re-use in constructing this product.
      pSig - String form of the signature. Looks like "-+++0".
      Throws:
      BadSignatureException - Thrown when an invalid signature is found

    • getCommuteSign

      public final int getCommuteSign(int pRow, int pCol)
      Return a measure of whether blades pj and pk commute. Return a 1 if they commute. Return a 0 otherwise.

      Specified by:
      getCommuteSign in interface CliffordProduct
      Parameters:
      pRow - int
      pCol - int
      Returns:
      int +1 if the blades at the row and column commute. 0 otherwise.

    • getComplementLeft

      public final Blade getComplementLeft(Blade pB1)
      This method takes the offered blade and hunts through the Cayley table to find another one such that the offered one left multiplied by the other produces the +pscalar blade.

      This method is a brute force search

      Parameters:
      pB1 - Blade for which a complement blade is sought
      Returns:
      Blade that is the complement of the input blade

    • getComplementRight

      public final Blade getComplementRight(Blade pB1)
      This method takes the offered blade and hunts through the Cayley table to find another one such that the offered one right multiplied by the other produces the +pscalar blade.

      This method is a brute force search

      Parameters:
      pB1 - Blade for which a complement blade is sought
      Returns:
      Blade that is the complement of the input blade

    • getGradeRange

      public final int[] getGradeRange(byte pGrade)
      Get start and end index from the GradeRange array for grade pGrade.
      There is currently no protection on this method. If someone asks for a grade that isn't in range, they WILL get -1 in the cells.
      Specified by:
      getGradeRange in interface CliffordProduct
      Parameters:
      pGrade - byte primitive = grade for which the range is needed
      Returns:
      int[] start and end indexes returned as a int[] array

    • getResult

      public final Blade getResult(Blade pRow, Blade pCol)
      This method takes two blades, finds their index values in the basis, and then retrieves the index value of their product from the Cayley table. With the result index, it return the basis blade at that location.

      One could just multiply the two blades using BladeDuet.simplify() and get the blade returned. That's how the Cayley table was constructed in the first place.

      Parameters:
      pRow - Blade acting as the row entry for the Cayley table result
      pCol - Blade acting as the column entry for the Cayley table result
      Returns:
      Blade representing the result found in the Cayley table. If none found, null is returned.

    • getSign

      public final int getSign(int pRow, int pCol)
      Return the sign of an element in the geometric multiplication result table.
      Specified by:
      getSign in interface CliffordProduct
      Parameters:

      pCol - int
      Returns:

    • getSign

      public final int getSign(Blade pRow, Blade pCol)
      This method takes two blades, finds their index values in the basis, and then retrieves the sign variation at that location in the Cayley table.

      Parameters:
      pRow - Blade acting as the row entry for the Cayley table result
      pCol - Blade acting as the column entry for the Cayley table result
      Returns:
      int representing the sign of the result found in the Cayley table. If none found, 0 is returned.

    • signature

      public final String signature()
      Return the signature of the generating geometry. This lists the squares of the generators in their numeric order.

      Specified by:
      signature in interface CliffordProduct
      Returns:
      String that is the actual signature of the GProduct.

      public final byte[] nsignature()
      This method returns a copy of the byte array that is the signature of this GProduct.

      Returns:
      byte array copy of the numeric signature of the GProduct

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(GProduct pIn)
      I may need to come up with a better idea here. String comparisons might not be how we should compare GP's. They should probably be size first and then string comparisons that are restricted to p, q, r measures.
      Specified by:
      compareTo in interface Comparable<GProduct>
      Parameters:
      pIn - GProduct the other GP to compare to this one
      Returns:
      int comparison of the two GProducts
